name: Chateau Marlborough

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night and were impressed with many aspects of the hotel - the bedroom itself was very comfortable and very tastefully decorated, reception staff were very pleasant and it's located very close to the town centre. As previous reviewers have mentioned though, the quality of the fittings in the bathroom was not to the standard of the rest of the room. Everything was clean and functional, but the contemporary, fresh fittings in the bedroom only highlighted the tired and rather shabby look of the bathroom. I understand that they're currently in the process of modernising their bathrooms - had they done this before our stay then I would have no hesitation in giving it an 'excellent' rating.
reviews.title: A bit disappointing - but still a comfortable stay
A great place to stay
reviews.text: A very pleasant hotel in a town where most of the accommodation is in motels or B&Bs. There is a high standard of decor throughout and the staff were friendly and helpful. As the hotel only serves breakfast, they were happy to recommend some places to eat. Our room was clean and comfortable, with a small kitchenette area. I'm sure the bathroom could be made more spacious if some of the doors and partition walls could be removed! The hotel has a very pleasing exterior with a small, gated pool area and plenty of car parking. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chateau Marlborough advertises itself as luxury accommodation. Ours was adequate rather than real luxury.
reviews.title: adequate rather than luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a studio room that was advertised as having a full kitchen and bath. The former turned out to be 2 small electric rungs and a micro microwave,. And the latter was small and squashed into what at first we thought was a cupboard. The other washing facilities were adequate for one, There is a separate wc.
reviews.title: Great staff, odd bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apart from all the squash and squeeze in the washing areas, the room itself was adequate. Two easy chairs, one flat screen TV, and a workable desk. The whole well decorated and clean with good comfortable beds, linen and minor accoutrements.
reviews.title: More Travelodge than boutique 5 star hotel!

likes.liked: — The helpful manager made up for the shambles at breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights in one of their larger corner rooms, with a sofa and chairs to one end and a table to the other. The bathroom had a large spa bath, which was excellent to soak in.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.text: The reception staff we very helpful, more than willing to chat and pass on their local knowledge. The vineyards they suggested we visit for lunch was lovely (Allan Scott).
reviews.title: good place to stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great place to stay in the north of the South Island and only 20 minutes from the ferry at Picton.
reviews.title: Memorable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a late deal via WOTIF.COM, good value.
reviews.title: Executive Spa Suite great value for money!!

reviews.text: Lovely huge room, very clean and nicely fitted out.
reviews.title: Hotel with character

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent reception service....we turned up early and this was not a problem. Complimentary drinks and a chat with the friendly and informed bar manager in the evening in the guests bar. Room very smart but nothing special. Reasonable kitchen facilities. Funny bathroom set up with too many doors and an awkward shower over the bath. Large bed but a bit soft for my liking. Plasma TV and nice paintings and decorations generally. The whole place looks recently done up. Very central location with a large car park...walking distance from all parts of the town.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: As part of a film crew recently in Marlborough New Zealand, and under a heavy work load for 10 days, it was great to come home each night to the Chateau Marlbourough Hotel Blenheim. And by home, I certainally mean just that. Not only was the accommodation above standard expectations for a regional destination, never before have I slept in a "heavanly bed" of which I can guarentee a good nights sleep every time. These beds alone make the stay at Chateau Marlborough worth your while, and combined with exemplary staff who go above and beyond to assist in every facet of your stay, my experience couldn't have been more pleasureable. The bar and evening finger food during the week is a great touch, and I am sure in summer the pool would be a great way to end off the day.
reviews.title: Chateau with the lot!

reviews.text: Although I stayed in a standard room (complete with the most divine fresh coffee for my plunger) I did site inspect one of the executive suites and can higly recommend these to all, especially the corporate market.
reviews.title: Best in the Marlborough wine region

likes.liked: — Covenient location, good prices, great rooms and bed

reviews.text: I would like to send my thanks to eveyone working at the Chateau Malborough hotel Blenheim for their professionalism and "nothing is to difficult' attitude, and encouage others to take the time a stay a while when next you are in New Zealand
reviews.title: Great value, central location

reviews.text: What a perfect place to venture out to all the picturesque wineries in this delightful part of New Zealand.
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is about a 10 minute stroll out of town. Our room was tastefully furnished in modern design and was made up of a fully equipped kitchen with dining area and comfortable sofas to watch the flat screen tv. The bedroom also had a tv. It would have been so much better had it not been a ground floor room from a privacy point of view.
reviews.title: Modern Hotel

likes.liked: — Style and comfort of the room

reviews.title: Great position
reviews.text: Also, our Room (7) was next to the kitchen so we were woken quite early in the morning by activity in the kitchen which was a bit of a pain. We chose to walk into town to get breakfast rather than stay in the hotel – although the option was at least there if you didn’t want to make your own.
There is ample parking and a small pool area which we didn’t take advantage of. Good value for money.
reviews.title: Exceptional Service and Comfort
Very Comfortable
reviews.text: Great position in town and very friendly and helpful staff. Quite a nice little swimming pool with deck area for relaxing after a day's sightseeing. Room was spacious and comfortable and bathroom adequate. Breakfast was available to order by dish but it was just as easy to eat in town.

I just returned from a trip to NZ, and Blenheim was one of my stops. Before my arrival, I had difficulty confirming my reservation through the booking agent (Hotel Club). Jacqui at Chateau Marlborough, without me asking, stepped in and contacted the booking agent to resolve it. Lynley and her staff, including Jacquie, Sharyn and Emma, were likewise very helpful before and during my stay. The room was large, well-appointed and very comfortable, and of a better standard than most hotels in the major cities I visited. It included a large kitchen, a sitting area, desk and a wall-mounted flat screen LCD TV. The beautiful town square is just across the street from the hotel, and in-town shops and restaurants are just minutes away.
reviews.title: Delightful base for winery visits

description: Marlborough's premier 5-Star boutique hotel overlooking Seymour Square Gardens prides itself on offering guests luxury accommodation with enviable attention to detail and all just a short walk from Blenheim's town centre. Enjoy an environment of seclusion, comfort and intimacy with attentive yet unobtrusive service. Our staff continually strives to exceed guests expectations. Chateau Marlborough will cater to your every need with breakfast restaurant, full conference, house bar facilities and swimming pool.
